intro: Manettia rosea, commonly known as the pink bellflower, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling bells, hence its common name. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy appearance. Manettia rosea is typically grown as a houseplant due to its preference for warm, humid environments and indirect sunlight.
